jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

52B8A0065980410B928D124A13533608.description:
Identify governments as the
providers of public goods and
services.

00CC7E1002E34F1F9778996682E66656.description:
Describe examples of public
goods and services in the
community or state.

B6964BFD5934468083F422E24DB5ED12.description:
Compare/contrast public
schools and Catholic schools.

35E29C6F332C4DB2B5CDFCCD2AB89841.description:
Distinguish between public
goods and services and
private goods and services.

843CE0B9F9FB47A894F7CED6A19232AE.description: Understand the impact of government policies and decisions on production and consumption in the economy. Understand the moral implications of policies and decisions on production and consumption. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

406EB4B694694877B34BAFA6EF92668D.description:
Compare fair trade and the
Golden Rule.

F83DF8FB1E9E4CF3AE9F29E190C86E2F.description:
Describe how money makes
exchange easier.

D791965098A84C06B8611EFB119F7DC6.description:
List examples of exchanges
families make, with and
without money.

F7DB40F3383642FCA5ED9C5DBF39B25B.description:
Describe an exchange that
individual students have
made. Explain the results of
the trade/exchange. Discuss
how the trade was fair to all
parties.

045AF9C73A014AECA6EF334285D40218.description: Understanding trade as an exchange of goods or services. Understand moral values behind the understanding of trade as an exchange of goods and services. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

BF833DADEF8743999F8DA86746A015B6.description:
Explain that productive
resources are limited.

9152927F48D34476A4F10F1EE5B12A75.description:
Classify productive resources
as human, natural, and
capital.

55AA72F649884973AF84CDFAEEC92EB7.description:
List producers who
follow/adhere to Catholic
values. Explain why.

1BF25D1C0E7F4F19A2B81DBFF6196A6D.description:
List examples of producers in
the economy and identify
what they produce.

1CCC4E094F38423FADA015B3C48E5582.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by producers. Understand that scarcity necessitates producer choices which have moral implications. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7          Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those who will come after us. CSDS2 (7-12 CS)

ECFC7F726F1E4F31A1DD06E3282519D4.description:
Choose from among three or
more items and identify the
opportunity cost as the next
best alternative.

C6B36B2715F14236A20691008734943D.description:
Identify a consumer choice
made by families and explain
why a choice had to be made;
explain the choice based on
moral responsibilities.

4CDCF2F5EA694CACB0808ECBED79A487.description:
Match a list of wants with an
example of a good, service, or
leisure activity that satisfies
each wants.

425ED4123BED4BBDBFB34375C7348A87.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by consumers. Understand that scarcity necessitates consumer choices which have moral implications. Discriminate between what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4
Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

6F8433CC751B4A39AC59D5FEB2D3DB2C.description:
List the sources of money in
their life, and identify money
they receive for work.

DE2F25EA72F74C629935CDE9E914C070.description:
Identify producers of goods
and services in the
community.

6F5FECADAA69494A9F0218011244D880.description:
List jobs people do to earn
wages.

68911E368CEF4CFABE57109313E961CC.description:
Analyze the advantages and
disadvantages of distributing
a good or service in different
ways.

16ABE7B42EA74E57B2A7EB1B887A6E5F.description:
Explain how the choices we
make can be influenced by
our Catholic beliefs rather
than economics.

E9E141125B9E4FF2A2030AC0B09E6418.description:
Explain why a choice must be
made, given an example of a
limited resource and a list of
alternative uses for the
resource.

8100EBBC24BA4388AC646F02806C8EC6.description: Understand how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Understand the moral consequences of how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7 (7-12 CS)      Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions .CSIS7 (K-6 CS)

A70807673E614A27B31A507A7E4E4D70.description: Understand economic systems with an emphasis on the United States. Understand moral aspects of the economic systems of the United States.
